1. Initial state: Only object 3 was on the machine, and the light was on. When removed, light turned off. When put back, light turned on. This suggests object 3 is a blicket.

2. When object 0 was added with object 3, light stayed on. When object 3 was removed, light turned off (even though object 0 remained). This suggests object 0 is not a blicket.

3. Similar pattern with object 1 - when added alone, light turned on. When removed, light turned off. Suggests object 1 is a blicket.

4. Object 2 showed similar behavior to object 1 - appears to be a blicket.

5. Objects 4,5,6,7 were all tested together and didn't turn the machine on, suggesting none are blickets.

6. Further confirmation when object 1 was added with other non-blickets (4-7) and turned machine on, but removing object 1 turned it off.

7. Object 6 was tested in combination with objects 4,5,7 and didn't turn the machine on, and never showed any activation when present alone or with other objects.

Conclusion: Object 6 is not a blicket.

> False
